          "title": "Vintage Watches",
          "description": "\u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"color: #ffffff;\"\u003eVintage Watches\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/h1\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"color: #ffffff;\"\u003eA selection of vintage watches carefully vetted by the Shop team.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e",
          "featured_image": "\/\/cdn.shopify.com\/s\/files\/1\/0146\/0732\/collections\/WATCHES.jpg?v=1646069883",
          "image": "\/\/cdn.shopify.com\/s\/files\/1\/0146\/0732\/collections\/WATCHES.jpg?v=1646069883",
          "products": [{"id":6714713735243,"title":"1978 Rolex GMT-Master Ref. 1675 'Mark 3 Radial Dial'","handle":"gmt-1675-radial-dial","description":"\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe charm of a Mark 3 \"Radial Dial\" plus beautiful condition and the pop of a \"Pepsi\" bezel insert.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRolex originally introduced the GMT-Master ref. 6542 in 1955 to provide airline pilots with a watch that could easily display two time-zones at once. Rolex replaced ref. 6542 with ref. 1675 in 1959, and the company has continued to produce variants of the GMT-Master ever since.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis GMT dates to 1978, and it features a beautiful Mark 3, matte Radial dial. The dial falls into the Mark 3 category because of the serial number range and certain dial characteristics, like the lume plot placement. The lume plots on the dial for the hour markers are more central on the dial and further away from the edge. This gives the Mark 3 a different look when compared to all other GMTs. Radial dial GMT’s are highly sought after due to the rarity and sheer difference in design. They don’t come up terribly often, and when we had the chance to offer this one, we were quite pleased.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe present example is in overall beautiful and honest condition. From the vibrant Pepsi bezel to the creamy lume color, this GMT has a lot going for it. When people look at a GMT, one of the first things that tends to catch their eye is the bezel, and that is why many collectors, and those looking for a GMT in particular, can get a bit obsessed with finding that perfect bezel. The colors have stayed vibrant, with a small amount of fade on the blue portion, and the red half has a beautiful, almost raspberry coloring when the light hits it at just the right angle.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eGMT Masters continue to be some of the most sought after and collectible watches out there and this is an excellent opportunity to get an uncommon dial variation in great condition. The fun thing about vintage Rolex is how all the small details make a huge difference between watches.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine Print\u003c\/h2\u003e\nMaker: Rolex\u003cbr\u003eModel: GMT-Master\u003cbr\u003eReference: 1675\u003cbr\u003eYear: 1978\u003cbr\u003eCase No: 5028089\u003cbr\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel\u003cbr\u003eDimensions: 39mm diameter; 12.5mm thickness\u003cbr\u003eCrystal: Plexiglass \u003cbr\u003eLume: Yes, tritium \u003cbr\u003eCaliber: Rolex, self-winding, caliber 1575 \u003cbr\u003eBracelet\/Strap: Rolex, stainless steel, solid link ref. 78360 Rolex Oyster bracelet with 580 endlinks (Approximate max wrist size 8.25in \/ 210mm)\u003cbr\u003eLug Width: 20mm \u003cbr\u003eBox\/Papers: No\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhat We Love And What You Should Know\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings We Love:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Distinctive 'Radial' Mark 3 dial\u003cbr\u003e- Excellent Pepsi bezel colors\u003cbr\u003e- Rare variant in excellent condition\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To Know:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Very light scratches on case\u003cbr\u003e-  Lume in hour hand has been color corrected\u003cbr\u003e- Bracelet dates to 1976\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis GMT is in overall excellent, attractive condition. Overall, the watch has a very crisp feeling on the wrist with a sharp case and clean colors. The case is strong with scratches and light nicks. The case appears to have been very lightly polished in the past. The caseback has a few marks and scratches. The numbers are visible between both sets of lugs. The back of the lugs have some marks from the removal and placement of the bracelet.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial has retained its matte finish and is in very nice condition with some light patina throughout. The lume on the dial has developed patina aging to a pleasing creamy off-white color. The handset has some patina and is of the correct length and style for this period with a large GMT hand. The hour hand has been color corrected to match the rest of the lume. The lume on the rest of the hands is original and has developed a patina similar to that of the dial.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe \"Pepsi\" bezel with a red back has aged beautifully. The bezel also has some spots of wear and marks throughout. The Rolex solid-link Oyster bracelet is an earlier replacement although in good condition with light scratches and light stretch. The clasp is marked \"A,\" indicating a 1976 manufacture. data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe charm of a Mark 3 \"Radial Dial\" plus beautiful condition and the pop of a \"Pepsi\" bezel insert.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eRolex originally introduced the GMT-Master ref. 6542 in 1955 to provide airline pilots with a watch that could easily display two time-zones at once. Rolex replaced ref. 6542 with ref. 1675 in 1959, and the company has continued to produce variants of the GMT-Master ever since.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis GMT dates to 1978, and it features a beautiful Mark 3, matte Radial dial. The dial falls into the Mark 3 category because of the serial number range and certain dial characteristics, like the lume plot placement. The lume plots on the dial for the hour markers are more central on the dial and further away from the edge. This gives the Mark 3 a different look when compared to all other GMTs. Radial dial GMT’s are highly sought after due to the rarity and sheer difference in design. They don’t come up terribly often, and when we had the chance to offer this one, we were quite pleased.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe present example is in overall beautiful and honest condition. From the vibrant Pepsi bezel to the creamy lume color, this GMT has a lot going for it. When people look at a GMT, one of the first things that tends to catch their eye is the bezel, and that is why many collectors, and those looking for a GMT in particular, can get a bit obsessed with finding that perfect bezel. The colors have stayed vibrant, with a small amount of fade on the blue portion, and the red half has a beautiful, almost raspberry coloring when the light hits it at just the right angle.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eGMT Masters continue to be some of the most sought after and collectible watches out there and this is an excellent opportunity to get an uncommon dial variation in great condition. The fun thing about vintage Rolex is how all the small details make a huge difference between watches.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine Print\u003c\/h2\u003e\nMaker: Rolex\u003cbr\u003eModel: GMT-Master\u003cbr\u003eReference: 1675\u003cbr\u003eYear: 1978\u003cbr\u003eCase No: 5028089\u003cbr\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel\u003cbr\u003eDimensions: 39mm diameter; 12.5mm thickness\u003cbr\u003eCrystal: Plexiglass \u003cbr\u003eLume: Yes, tritium \u003cbr\u003eCaliber: Rolex, self-winding, caliber 1575 \u003cbr\u003eBracelet\/Strap: Rolex, stainless steel, solid link ref. 78360 Rolex Oyster bracelet with 580 endlinks (Approximate max wrist size 8.25in \/ 210mm)\u003cbr\u003eLug Width: 20mm \u003cbr\u003eBox\/Papers: No\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhat We Love And What You Should Know\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings We Love:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Distinctive 'Radial' Mark 3 dial\u003cbr\u003e- Excellent Pepsi bezel colors\u003cbr\u003e- Rare variant in excellent condition\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To Know:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Very light scratches on case\u003cbr\u003e-  Lume in hour hand has been color corrected\u003cbr\u003e- Bracelet dates to 1976\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis GMT is in overall excellent, attractive condition. Translating from Rolex, the \"Precision\" branding indicates a manually-wound movement, just as \"Perpetual\" points to a self-winding or automatic movement powering the watch. Rolex watches like this one are consistently compelling, never going out of style.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis example of the Oysterdate Precision stands out due to its modest size and feel on the wrist. Oyster cases measuring 34mm diameter were long considered to be less desirable than larger models from the company, but over the past few years, this has changed quite drastically. As size preferences have skewed slightly smaller, appreciation of these 34mm Oysters has risen thanks to an extremely comfortable on-the-wrist feel.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To The numbers are clearly visible between both sets of lugs. \u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial is in great condition with a very light patina overall. data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eEverything you want and nothing you don't in a vintage Rolex.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe stainless steel Oyster case is already an iconic vintage look, but when you add in an interestingly finished dial, and a manually-wound movement, the watch suddenly becomes something to write home about. Translating from Rolex, the \"Precision\" branding indicates a manually-wound movement, just as \"Perpetual\" points to a self-winding or automatic movement powering the watch. Rolex watches like this one are consistently compelling, never going out of style.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis example of the Oysterdate Precision stands out due to its modest size and feel on the wrist. Oyster cases measuring 34mm diameter were long considered to be less desirable than larger models from the company, but over the past few years, this has changed quite drastically. As size preferences have skewed slightly smaller, appreciation of these 34mm Oysters has risen thanks to an extremely comfortable on-the-wrist feel.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis Rolex is in good, honest overall condition. The case is sharp with scratches and few light nicks. The underside of the lugs shows some scratches from the bracelet. The numbers are clearly visible between both sets of lugs. \u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial is in great condition with a very light patina overall. The lume plots are all-around full, with an attractive patina. There is some more noticeable patina on the dial near the edges and lume plots. The lume in the hands has developed some patina. The hour markers and hands have developed patina.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe Rolex Oyster bracelet is in good condition with scratches and some light stretch to the links. The clasp has some scratches to both sides. The crystal has some scratches. The dial, crown, case, movement, and bracelet are all signed by Rolex. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e"},{"id":6719480070219,"title":"1970 Rolex GMT-Master Ref. 1675 'Root Beer' In Two-Tone","handle":"rootbeer-gmt","description":"\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eAll of the right brown tones, there is nothing like a vintage Root Beer GMT.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Rolex GMT-Master is one of the most recognized watches in history. As a purpose-built tool watch, it was introduced in 1955 for commercial Pan Am pilots crossing the globe. The 24-hour rotating bezel along with the GMT hand allowed, at a glance, a reading of one's local and home time without having to adjust the crown during travel.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWith the ref. 1675, the first generation of the two-tone GMT, there are a few differentiating characteristics. A design aspect that Rolex fans love about the earlier ref. 1675 is what is known as a \"nipple dial.\" The name comes from the smaller, circular, applied hour markers with luminous material in their centers.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe quickest way to tell if a two-tone GMT is a ref. 1675 or a ref. 16753? Look at the crown on the dial. Ref. 1675s have applied metal coronets at 12 o'clock on the dial, whereas second generation ref. 16753s have printed logos. Rolex also changed the order of the hands on during this reference change. The ref. 1675 stacks the hands in the following order: GMT, hour, minute, seconds; while on the ref. 16750 (all-steel) and ref. 16753 (two-tone), the GMT hand is positioned above the hour hand but below the minute hand.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe \"Root Beer\" gets its nickname from the brown dial that, at times, is known to change in the light from a rich chocolate brown to a more reddish burgundy tone, or anywhere in between. The well-preserved dial color on this example transitions from a rich earthy brown to a deep wine color depending on the light. Add to that the gold \"nipple\" hour markers and the gilt text, which each fit quite nicely with the light yellow patina on the lume. To finish off the look, it’s fitted with a classic two-tone Jubilee bracelet, a wonderfully comfortable complement on the wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e \u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine Print\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaker: Rolex\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eModel: GMT-Master\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eReference: 1675\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eYear: 1970\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCase No: 2477262\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel and gold\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eDimensions: 39.5mm diameter; 13mm thickness\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCrystal: Plexiglass\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eLume: Yes, tritium\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCaliber: Rolex, self-winding, caliber 1575\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBracelet\/Strap: Rolex, stainless steel and gold, ref. 6251H Jubilee with No. 55 end links \u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\n\u003cspan data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e(Approximate max wrist size 6.75in \/ 171mm)\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eLug Width: 20mm\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBox\/Papers: No\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhat We Love And What You Should Know\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThings We Love:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- \"Root Beer\" motif\u003cbr\u003e- Two-tone case and bracelet\u003cbr\u003e- \"Nipple\" dial with excellent patina on lume\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThings To Know:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Scratches on case and bracelet\u003cbr\u003e- Case is lightly polished\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThis GMT-Master is in overall great and honest condition. The case is strong with scratches. The case appears to have been polished. The numbers are visible between both sets of lugs. The back of the lugs have some marks from the removal and placement of the bracelet.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe dial has developed a light patina throughout. The lume on the hour markers on the dial has developed patina and has aged to a creamy, almost golden color. The dial printing is crisp. The handset has some patina and is of the correct length and style for this period. The lume on the hands has developed patina and is very close in color to that of the dial lume.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe bezel is in overall good condition with a slightly faded patina that is stunning in the metal providing a really nice look. The bracelet is in good condition with scratches; there is little stretch between the links. The clasp is stamped \"2 67,\" corresponding to a second quarter of 1967 manufacture, indicating it is an earlier replacement. The crystal has scratches. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eAll of the right brown tones, there is nothing like a vintage Root Beer GMT.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Rolex GMT-Master is one of the most recognized watches in history. As a purpose-built tool watch, it was introduced in 1955 for commercial Pan Am pilots crossing the globe. The 24-hour rotating bezel along with the GMT hand allowed, at a glance, a reading of one's local and home time without having to adjust the crown during travel.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWith the ref. 1675, the first generation of the two-tone GMT, there are a few differentiating characteristics. A design aspect that Rolex fans love about the earlier ref. 1675 is what is known as a \"nipple dial.\" The name comes from the smaller, circular, applied hour markers with luminous material in their centers.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe quickest way to tell if a two-tone GMT is a ref. 1675 or a ref. 16753? Look at the crown on the dial. Ref. 1675s have applied metal coronets at 12 o'clock on the dial, whereas second generation ref. 16753s have printed logos. Rolex also changed the order of the hands on during this reference change. The ref. 1675 stacks the hands in the following order: GMT, hour, minute, seconds; while on the ref. 16750 (all-steel) and ref. 16753 (two-tone), the GMT hand is positioned above the hour hand but below the minute hand.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe \"Root Beer\" gets its nickname from the brown dial that, at times, is known to change in the light from a rich chocolate brown to a more reddish burgundy tone, or anywhere in between. The well-preserved dial color on this example transitions from a rich earthy brown to a deep wine color depending on the light. Add to that the gold \"nipple\" hour markers and the gilt text, which each fit quite nicely with the light yellow patina on the lume. To finish off the look, it’s fitted with a classic two-tone Jubilee bracelet, a wonderfully comfortable complement on the wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e \u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine Print\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaker: Rolex\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eModel: GMT-Master\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eReference: 1675\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eYear: 1970\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCase No: 2477262\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel and gold\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eDimensions: 39.5mm diameter; 13mm thickness\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCrystal: Plexiglass\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eLume: Yes, tritium\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCaliber: Rolex, self-winding, caliber 1575\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBracelet\/Strap: Rolex, stainless steel and gold, ref. 6251H Jubilee with No. 55 end links \u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\n\u003cspan data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e(Approximate max wrist size 6.75in \/ 171mm)\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eLug Width: 20mm\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBox\/Papers: No\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhat We Love And What You Should Know\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThings We Love:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- \"Root Beer\" motif\u003cbr\u003e- Two-tone case and bracelet\u003cbr\u003e- \"Nipple\" dial with excellent patina on lume\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThings To Know:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Scratches on case and bracelet\u003cbr\u003e- Case is lightly polished\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThis GMT-Master is in overall great and honest condition. The case is strong with scratches. The case appears to have been polished. The numbers are visible between both sets of lugs. The back of the lugs have some marks from the removal and placement of the bracelet.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe dial has developed a light patina throughout. The lume on the hour markers on the dial has developed patina and has aged to a creamy, almost golden color. The dial printing is crisp. The handset has some patina and is of the correct length and style for this period. The lume on the hands has developed patina and is very close in color to that of the dial lume.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe bezel is in overall good condition with a slightly faded patina that is stunning in the metal providing a really nice look. The bracelet is in good condition with scratches; there is little stretch between the links. The clasp is stamped \"2 67,\" corresponding to a second quarter of 1967 manufacture, indicating it is an earlier replacement. The crystal has scratches. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e"},{"id":6731912511563,"title":"1970s Certina Dress Watch Ref. 5210.136 In 18k Yellow Gold","handle":"18k-yellow-gold","description":"\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThis is a simple Certina dress watch in 18k yellow gold, an excellent example from a brand in the vintage world that is growing in popularity by the day.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eCertina was originally founded by the Kurth brothers in 1888, and the manufacturer first produced movements, and later watches, under the name Grana. The name was changed to Certina in 1939, and they quickly started producing automatic watches in the 1940s, eventually introducing the DS series in 1959. The DS divers, a few of which we have been happy to offer in the past, have taken hold in the larger vintage collecting universe over the past few years. On the back of the DS, Certina in general is growing in popularity as collectors continue to be impressed by the reliability and solid build quality. Modern Certina is having a bit of a moment as well here at the HODINKEE as the brand recently \u003c\/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/blogs\/journal\/certina-usa-dsph200-ph500-action-gmt\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/blogs\/journal\/certina-usa-dsph200-ph500-action-gmt\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ereturned to the U.S. market\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e exclusively through the Shop.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWith that growing appreciation, more attention has come to the lesser known Certina watches as collectors come to understand the build quality of the brand. Lesser known watches like this humble dress watch in 18k yellow gold. Whereas other brands that remain under-the-radar in the vintage world can sometimes disappoint in build quality, Certina impresses even the most seasoned of collectors. You can feel the difference right in your hand.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWhile the case is simple with four sharp lugs, this Certina's dial and hands are stunning and extremely well made. You can see the attention to detail in the black paint portion of the hands which ties into the black color within each hour marker as well as the simple vertically brushed finish. We are continually attracted to these non-lume watches as they can be worn a bit more worry-free. A simple knock on the table or door jam will not lead to damage to those pesky and fragile lume plots.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eLike Cole P says \"Always read the caseback.\" Turning this Certina around we find an engraving depicting The Three Crowns of Sweden, the national emblem, and reading \"FÖR NIT OCH REDLIGHET I RIKETS TJÄNST\" or, translated from Swedish, \"for zeal and honesty in service of the kingdom\" we can assume this watch was a gift given by a member of the Kingdom of Sweden to a great citizen or friend of the state.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis example is in really excellent condition with some light patina that presents nicely. The watch is even fitted to a Certina black leather strap with a signed gold-tone tang buckle.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 The case has some light scratches and warm patina but appears unpolished with sharp lines. The caseback has scratches and shows some wear. data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThis is a simple Certina dress watch in 18k yellow gold, an excellent example from a brand in the vintage world that is growing in popularity by the day.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eCertina was originally founded by the Kurth brothers in 1888, and the manufacturer first produced movements, and later watches, under the name Grana. The name was changed to Certina in 1939, and they quickly started producing automatic watches in the 1940s, eventually introducing the DS series in 1959. The DS divers, a few of which we have been happy to offer in the past, have taken hold in the larger vintage collecting universe over the past few years. On the back of the DS, Certina in general is growing in popularity as collectors continue to be impressed by the reliability and solid build quality. Modern Certina is having a bit of a moment as well here at the HODINKEE as the brand recently \u003c\/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/blogs\/journal\/certina-usa-dsph200-ph500-action-gmt\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/blogs\/journal\/certina-usa-dsph200-ph500-action-gmt\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ereturned to the U.S. market\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e exclusively through the Shop.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWith that growing appreciation, more attention has come to the lesser known Certina watches as collectors come to understand the build quality of the brand. Lesser known watches like this humble dress watch in 18k yellow gold. Whereas other brands that remain under-the-radar in the vintage world can sometimes disappoint in build quality, Certina impresses even the most seasoned of collectors. You can feel the difference right in your hand.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWhile the case is simple with four sharp lugs, this Certina's dial and hands are stunning and extremely well made. You can see the attention to detail in the black paint portion of the hands which ties into the black color within each hour marker as well as the simple vertically brushed finish. We are continually attracted to these non-lume watches as they can be worn a bit more worry-free. A simple knock on the table or door jam will not lead to damage to those pesky and fragile lume plots.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eLike Cole P says \"Always read the caseback.\" Turning this Certina around we find an engraving depicting The Three Crowns of Sweden, the national emblem, and reading \"FÖR NIT OCH REDLIGHET I RIKETS TJÄNST\" or, translated from Swedish, \"for zeal and honesty in service of the kingdom\" we can assume this watch was a gift given by a member of the Kingdom of Sweden to a great citizen or friend of the state.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis example is in really excellent condition with some light patina that presents nicely. The watch is even fitted to a Certina black leather strap with a signed gold-tone tang buckle.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings We Love:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Like NOS condition with Certina strap and tang buckle\u003cbr\u003e- Brushed finish on dial\u003cbr\u003e- Kingdom of Sweden engraving on caseback\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: light wear to the strap\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis Certina is in excellent, honest condition. The case has some light scratches and warm patina but appears unpolished with sharp lines. The caseback has scratches and shows some wear. The caseback engraving is crisp and deep, it is engraved \"FÖR NIT OCH REDLIGHET I RIKETS TJÄNST.\" The case number between the lugs at 12 o'clock is crisp and visible. The hallmark between the lugs at 6 o'clock is crisp and visible.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial is in great condition with a light patina throughout. There is a starburst pattern to the dial and patina. The applied hour markers, applied Certina logo, and hands have developed patina.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial, crown, case, and movement are signed by Certina. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e"},{"id":6680100962379,"title":"1970s Heuer Carrera Ref. 1153N With Gay Frères Bracelet","handle":"carrera-1153-gf-bracelet","description":"\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eHeuer and Gay Frères, name a better duo. We'll wait.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe Carrera ref. 1153 was part of the trio of automatic chronographs Heuer debuted in 1969 that housed the new caliber 11, one of the world's first automatic chronograph movements. The other watches included the Autavia ref. 1163 and the Monaco ref. 1133. Heuer was part of a coalition of brands – including Breitling, Dubois-Dépraz, and Hamilton-Buren – that helped bring one of the earliest automatic chronographs to market. Unlike the Monaco, which was a completely new watch for Heuer when it was introduced in 1969, the Carrera ref. 1153 was intended to be an evolution of the original Carrera, introduced in 1963.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe Carrera ref. 1153 retained the inner tension ring characteristic of the Carrera line that could display additional information, like the seconds track on the ref. 2447. Instead, the ref. 1153 used this inner ring to display a tachymeter track (and, in rare instances, other types of scales), with the seconds track on the edge of the dial itself. The new C-shaped case profile would give the Carrera a more modern 1970s feel, and now with an automatic movement, Heuer moved the crown to the other side of case, making it instantly recognizable as a self-winding watch with caliber 11. \u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe example we have here features a beautiful blue dial, a strong case, a correct Gay Frères \"beads-of-rice\" style bracelet, and the upgraded caliber 12 movement. Heuer had a few issues with the caliber 11 when it was first released, which they subsequently improved with the updated caliber 11-I, and then to the caliber 12. To read more on the differences between the Caliber 11, 11-I, and 12, take a look \u003c\/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"http:\/\/onthedash.com\/docs\/ChronomaticMovements.html\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-href=\"http:\/\/onthedash.com\/docs\/ChronomaticMovements.html\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ehere\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp Carrera ref. 1153N; learn more \u003c\/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"http:\/\/thoughts.onthedash.com\/thoughts\/mick-jagger\/\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To Know:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e- Scratches on case\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis Carrera is in overall nice, honest condition. The case shows signs of a previous polish and has some scratches. The finish is still visible on the top of the case. The rear of the lugs show some marks from bracelet removal. The numbers between both sets of lugs are slightly damaged from the bracelet rubbing over the years yet remain readable with a loupe.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial and hands are in good condition with some patina. The lume on the dial has developed patina and has aged to an attractive off-white color. The lume in the hands has developed patina that is similar to that of the dial. The hands themselves have developed some patina.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe bracelet is in good condition with some scratches and some stretch. data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eHeuer and Gay Frères, name a better duo. We'll wait.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe Carrera ref. 1153 was part of the trio of automatic chronographs Heuer debuted in 1969 that housed the new caliber 11, one of the world's first automatic chronograph movements. The other watches included the Autavia ref. 1163 and the Monaco ref. 1133. Heuer was part of a coalition of brands – including Breitling, Dubois-Dépraz, and Hamilton-Buren – that helped bring one of the earliest automatic chronographs to market. Unlike the Monaco, which was a completely new watch for Heuer when it was introduced in 1969, the Carrera ref. 1153 was intended to be an evolution of the original Carrera, introduced in 1963.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe Carrera ref. 1153 retained the inner tension ring characteristic of the Carrera line that could display additional information, like the seconds track on the ref. 2447. Instead, the ref. 1153 used this inner ring to display a tachymeter track (and, in rare instances, other types of scales), with the seconds track on the edge of the dial itself. The new C-shaped case profile would give the Carrera a more modern 1970s feel, and now with an automatic movement, Heuer moved the crown to the other side of case, making it instantly recognizable as a self-winding watch with caliber 11. \u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe example we have here features a beautiful blue dial, a strong case, a correct Gay Frères \"beads-of-rice\" style bracelet, and the upgraded caliber 12 movement. Heuer had a few issues with the caliber 11 when it was first released, which they subsequently improved with the updated caliber 11-I, and then to the caliber 12. To read more on the differences between the Caliber 11, 11-I, and 12, take a look \u003c\/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"http:\/\/onthedash.com\/docs\/ChronomaticMovements.html\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-href=\"http:\/\/onthedash.com\/docs\/ChronomaticMovements.html\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003ehere\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003e.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis Carrera is in overall nice, honest condition. The case shows signs of a previous polish and has some scratches. The finish is still visible on the top of the case. The rear of the lugs show some marks from bracelet removal. The numbers between both sets of lugs are slightly damaged from the bracelet rubbing over the years yet remain readable with a loupe.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial and hands are in good condition with some patina. The lume on the dial has developed patina and has aged to an attractive off-white color. The lume in the hands has developed patina that is similar to that of the dial. The hands themselves have developed some patina.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe bracelet is in good condition with some scratches and some stretch. The dial, crown, case, movement, and bracelet are all signed by Heuer. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e"},{"id":6728371994699,"title":"1940s Universal Genève Compur Retailed by Türler Ref. 22455","handle":"turler-compur-chronograph-1","description":"\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThis chronograph isn’t just any old Compur. No, it’s manufactured by Universal Genève and retailed by Türler (as you can see on the dial), and has pink-gold lugs on a steel case.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eUniversal Genève is the king of vintage chronographs, so when you add a dial signed by Türler, the Swiss king of retail, you have a golden combination. While it's rare to find this combination of Universal Genève and Türler, it is even more rare to find a Compur like this one produced with a steel case and pink-gold lugs. Put all of this together and you have one incredible chrono – not to mention it just looks really good on the wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFounded in 1883, Zurich (in the German-speaking area of Switzerland) based retailer Türler has served as a retailer for many of the best brands in Swiss watchmaking including Universal Genève.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWe paired this Türler signed UG with our brown calfskin watch strap for no other reason than it looks good and we like the strap. data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThis chronograph isn’t just any old Compur. No, it’s manufactured by Universal Genève and retailed by Türler (as you can see on the dial), and has pink-gold lugs on a steel case.\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eUniversal Genève is the king of vintage chronographs, so when you add a dial signed by Türler, the Swiss king of retail, you have a golden combination. While it's rare to find this combination of Universal Genève and Türler, it is even more rare to find a Compur like this one produced with a steel case and pink-gold lugs. Put all of this together and you have one incredible chrono – not to mention it just looks really good on the wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eFounded in 1883, Zurich (in the German-speaking area of Switzerland) based retailer Türler has served as a retailer for many of the best brands in Swiss watchmaking including Universal Genève.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWe paired this Türler signed UG with our brown calfskin watch strap for no other reason than it looks good and we like the strap. That's it.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine Print\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings We Love:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e- Patina on dial\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch wrist.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e"},{"id":6719476924491,"title":"1979 Rolex GMT-Master Ref. 16753 In Two-Tone","handle":"gmt-gold-steel-ref-16753","description":"\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\"Nipple Dial.\"\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Full Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eJust as Danny Milton articulated in his HODINKEE piece entitled Second Opinions Two-Tone Isn't Ugly, \"two-tone is the physical embodiment of work-hard, play-hard.\" There's an argument to be made that no brand has executed two-tone better than Rolex. The brand began offering watches in mixed metal beginning in the 1940s and 50s. We think Danny is onto something here. Two-tone isn't ugly, but it does need to be executed well. In the case of this ref. 1675\/3 GMT, the mix of steel and gold just works.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWith the ref. 16753, the second generation of the two-tone GMT, there are a few differentiating characteristics both in design and functionality. First, as a watch from the late 1970s, we get some creature comfort in a quick-set date function made possible by the updated Rolex caliber 3075 inside. Secondly, this 16753 retains an acrylic crystal. Around this period, Rolex was transitioning to sapphire but examples with the older material have the added benefit of that hint of vintage charm. A design aspect that Rolex fans love about the earliest two-tone GMTs  is what is known as the \"nipple dial.\" The name comes from the smaller, circular, applied hour markers with luminous material in their centers. Rolex stuck to the iconic hour marker design in early ref. 16753 examples before moving to larger, more standard, applied hour markers.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis example of the GMT-Master serves as a great reminder of how two-tone can just work in the right execution. The overall black and gold motif of this watch is really pleasing in the metal and stunning on the wrist. With a bit of patina developing to the lume on the hands and on the applied markers here, the look is even furthered. The color of the lume looks closer to a gold rather than cream, especially with the gold metal surrounding it. There's no better bracelet for this watch than the two-tone Oyster, a bracelet that has become iconic in its own right. The Oyster fitted here matches the condition of the watch really well.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine folded-link Oyster ref. 78363 with stainless steel 480 end links (Approximate max wrist size 7.75in \/ 197mm)\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" Love And What You Should Know\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings We data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis GMT is in overall great, attractive condition. The case has scratches. Overall, the gold portions of the case and bracelet have developed a warm patina. The numbers are visible between both sets of lugs. The back of the lugs have some marks from the removal and placement of the bracelet.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial has developed a light patina throughout, this can be hard to notice. The gloss finish is really clean with only small imperfections visible under a loupe. The lume on the hour markers on the dial has developed patina and aged to a creamy off-white color. The handset has some patina and is of the correct length and style for this period. The lume on the hands has developed patina and is very close in color to that of the dial lume. \u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe bezel is in overall great condition. The bracelet is in good condition with scratches and a little stretch between the links. One of the center gold links at the end of the bracelet is slightly discolored. The clasp is stamped \"LT11,\" corresponding to a November of 2009 manufacture, meaning it is later than the watch. The crystal is in good condition. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch Story\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eJust as Danny Milton articulated in his HODINKEE piece entitled Second Opinions Two-Tone Isn't Ugly, \"two-tone is the physical embodiment of work-hard, play-hard.\" There's an argument to be made that no brand has executed two-tone better than Rolex. The brand began offering watches in mixed metal beginning in the 1940s and 50s. We think Danny is onto something here. Two-tone isn't ugly, but it does need to be executed well. In the case of this ref. 1675\/3 GMT, the mix of steel and gold just works.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eWith the ref. 16753, the second generation of the two-tone GMT, there are a few differentiating characteristics both in design and functionality. First, as a watch from the late 1970s, we get some creature comfort in a quick-set date function made possible by the updated Rolex caliber 3075 inside. Secondly, this 16753 retains an acrylic crystal. Around this period, Rolex was transitioning to sapphire but examples with the older material have the added benefit of that hint of vintage charm. A design aspect that Rolex fans love about the earliest two-tone GMTs  is what is known as the \"nipple dial.\" The name comes from the smaller, circular, applied hour markers with luminous material in their centers. Rolex stuck to the iconic hour marker design in early ref. 16753 examples before moving to larger, more standard, applied hour markers.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis example of the GMT-Master serves as a great reminder of how two-tone can just work in the right execution. The overall black and gold motif of this watch is really pleasing in the metal and stunning on the wrist. With a bit of patina developing to the lume on the hands and on the applied markers here, the look is even furthered. The color of the lume looks closer to a gold rather than cream, especially with the gold metal surrounding it. There's no better bracelet for this watch than the two-tone Oyster, a bracelet that has become iconic in its own right. The Oyster fitted here matches the condition of the watch really well.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eThe Fine data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThings To Know:\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Scratches on case\u003cbr\u003e- Later bracelet\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThis GMT is in overall great, attractive condition. The case has scratches. Overall, the gold portions of the case and bracelet have developed a warm patina. The numbers are visible between both sets of lugs. The back of the lugs have some marks from the removal and placement of the bracelet.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe dial has developed a light patina throughout, this can be hard to notice. The gloss finish is really clean with only small imperfections visible under a loupe. The lume on the hour markers on the dial has developed patina and aged to a creamy off-white color. The handset has some patina and is of the correct length and style for this period. The lume on the hands has developed patina and is very close in color to that of the dial lume. \u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"font-weight: 400;\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\" data-mce-style=\"font-weight: 400;\"\u003eThe bezel is in overall great condition. The bracelet is in good condition with scratches and a little stretch between the links. One of the center gold links at the end of the bracelet is slightly discolored. The clasp is stamped \"LT11,\" corresponding to a November of 2009 manufacture, meaning it is later than the watch. The crystal is in good condition. BA 8080101 A","handle":"bulova-marine-star-chrono-2","description":"\u003ch2\u003eWhy This Watch Matters\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3\u003eThis Bulova Marine Star is a rare, oversized, military-inspired chronograph that's recognized by its red star logo on the dial. \u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eThe Full Story\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eJ. Bulova Company was founded by a Bohemian immigrant, Joseph Bulova, in New York City in 1875. By 1912, Mr. Bulova opened his first manufacturing facility dedicated to watches, and by 1923, his company was reincorporated under the name Bulova Watch Company. The brand is known for its long and innovative history as a firmly American watch manufacturer, including the release of the Accutron – the world's first fully electronic watch using tuning fork-based technology – in 1960.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Marine Star chronograph is a watch we don't see very often at all. It's a gorgeous chronograph with some really special details. The watch features an oversized 43mm case, a matte black dial with two large engine-turned sub registers, and a rotating bezel. Another intriguing detail is the 10 red stars on the dial in a circle pattern, with Marine Star in text above. The watch has a screw-down crown and case. The caseback has an interesting design with an anchor on top of a ship's wheel. In general, the Marine Star has a strong resemblance to the \u003ca href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/collections\/vintage-watches\/products\/1960s-zenith-cairelli-reference-cp-2-chronograph?variant=30733641515083\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eZenith Cairelli CP-2 Chronograph\u003c\/a\u003e, designed for the Italian Air Force.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe paired this Bulova chronograph with our Sedona Strap in Green to lean into the military references that this watch draws on.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eThe Fine Print\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMaker: Bulova\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eModel: Marine Star\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eReference: BA 8080101 A\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eYear: Circa 1970s\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCase No: 0773\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eDimensions: 43mm diameter; The case is strong with scratches and a clear bevel on the lugs. The underside of the case near ten o'clock has a few nicks. The reverse of the lugs show scratches from strap removal. The writing on the caseback is visible with the exception of the case number, which can only be read under a loupe at an angle. There are a few scratches on the caseback from removal.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe dial is in great condition with a light patina. The lume on the hands and dial have developed an even and matching patina. The hands have developed some patina.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe bezel is in good condition with some scratches and signs of wear around the edge as well as concentrated near the 15-minute marker. The lume on the bezel at 12 o'clock has darkened with age. The screw-down crown is unsigned, which is common for this model. The crystal has some scratches, especially near one o'clock. logo on the dial. \u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eThe Full Story\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eJ. Bulova Company was founded by a Bohemian immigrant, Joseph Bulova, in New York City in 1875. By 1912, Mr. Bulova opened his first manufacturing facility dedicated to watches, and by 1923, his company was reincorporated under the name Bulova Watch Company. The brand is known for its long and innovative history as a firmly American watch manufacturer, including the release of the Accutron – the world's first fully electronic watch using tuning fork-based technology – in 1960.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Marine Star chronograph is a watch we don't see very often at all. It's a gorgeous chronograph with some really special details. The watch features an oversized 43mm case, a matte black dial with two large engine-turned sub registers, and a rotating bezel. Another intriguing detail is the 10 red stars on the dial in a circle pattern, with Marine Star in text above. The watch has a screw-down crown and case. The caseback has an interesting design with an anchor on top of a ship's wheel. In general, the Marine Star has a strong resemblance to the \u003ca href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/collections\/vintage-watches\/products\/1960s-zenith-cairelli-reference-cp-2-chronograph?variant=30733641515083\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eZenith Cairelli CP-2 Chronograph\u003c\/a\u003e, designed for the Italian Air Force.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe paired this Bulova chronograph with our Sedona Strap in Green to lean into the military references that this watch draws on.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eThe Fine Print\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eMaker: Bulova\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eModel: Marine Star\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eReference: BA 8080101 A\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eYear: Circa 1970s\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCase No: 0773\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaterial: Stainless steel\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eDimensions: 43mm diameter; 12mm thickness\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCrystal: Plexiglass\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eLume: Yes, tritium\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCaliber: Valjoux, manually wound, caliber 7731\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBracelet\/Strap: \u003ca href=\"https:\/\/shop.hodinkee.com\/collections\/straps\/products\/sedona-strap-in-green\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eThe Sedona Watch Strap in Green\u003c\/a\u003e\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e Lug Width: 22mm\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBox\/Papers: No\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eWhat We Love and What You Should Know\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat We Love:\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e- Oversized 43mm case\u003cbr\u003e- Engine-turned sub registers\u003cbr\u003e- Distinct red star logo\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat You Should Know:\u003c\/p\u003e\n- Scratches on case\u003cbr\u003e- Some wear on bezel\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cbr\u003eThis Marine Star is in great, honest condition. The case is strong with scratches and a clear bevel on the lugs. The underside of the case near ten o'clock has a few nicks. The reverse of the lugs show scratches from strap removal. The writing on the caseback is visible with the exception of the case number, which can only be read under a loupe at an angle. There are a few scratches on the caseback from removal.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe dial is in great condition with a light patina. The lume on the hands and dial have developed an even and matching patina. The hands have developed some patina.\u003cbr data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe bezel is in good condition with some scratches and signs of wear around the edge as well as concentrated near the 15-minute marker. The lume on the bezel at 12 o'clock has darkened with age. The screw-down crown is unsigned, which is common for this model. The crystal has some scratches, especially near one o'clock. This watch was photographed on a 175mm\/6.9inch wrist.\u003c\/p\u003e"}]

These straps are designed with old timepieces in mind, and remain a staple of the watch collecting landscape even today. Often copied, never duplicated, these hand-stitched straps will make you remember the days men were men and tool watches were really tools. Fathoms.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eOur Take\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThese are the straps that made us famous – or maybe it's the other way around. Our original vintage-inspired straps set the watch world on fire when we began to sell them online over four years ago. These straps are designed with old timepieces in mind, and remain a staple of the watch collecting landscape even today. Often copied, never duplicated, these hand-stitched straps will make you remember the days men were men and tool watches were really tools. These are casual, rugged straps that will last a while.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\n\u003ch2\u003eApproximate Dimensions\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRegular 20mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLength: 120mm \/ 75mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLug width: 20mm; buckle width: 16mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003c\/ul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eRegular 22mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLength: 120mm \/ 75mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLug width: 22mm; buckle width: 18mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003c\/ul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShort 20mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLength: 105mm \/ 65mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLug width: 20mm; buckle width: 16mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003c\/ul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eShort 22mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cul\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLength: 105mm \/ 65mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003eLug width: 22mm; buckle width: 18mm\u003c\/li\u003e\n\u003c\/ul\u003e\n\u003c\/ul\u003e"},{"id":11792515279,"title":"Sea Blue Calfskin Watch Strap","handle":"sea-blue-calfskin-watch-strap","description":"\u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\n\u003ch2 class=\"p1\"\u003ePairs Well With\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003ch3 class=\"p1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThese are the definition of the \"all-purpose\" strap, so feel free to mix and match between case sizes, metals, and vintages.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/h3\u003e\n\u003ch2 class=\"p1\"\u003eOur Take\u003c\/h2\u003e\n\u003cp class=\"p1\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSoft, pliable, thin, and insanely versatile – these single-layer calf straps might be the best \"all-purpose\" strap in the world. positioned up against the wall or on a shelf or side table in your home. The Beosound Balance offers impressive sound compared to its size.\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003c\/article\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"row uspContainer\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"greyBorder col-xs-12 contrasts strongly with its raw, high-performing sound. And, with a shape distinctly broken into two components, Beosound Balance features a luxurious design in an interior object form. Bang \u0026amp; Olufsen collaborated on the design with Benjamin Hubert of Layer Design, a creative studio from London highly specialized not only in design but also in creating unique user interfaces.\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-sln-id=\"atm_Text_description\"\u003e\u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe approach Beosound Balance for interaction\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and dim w\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ehen you walk away from \u003c\/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003espeaker\u003c\/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, leaving only the well-crafted aluminum surface data-sln-id=\"atm_TextAndImageVariants.fiftyFifty_fiftyfifty_description\"\u003eBeosound Balance delivers carefully controlled beams of sound for a clear acoustic experience from the front and rich sound enhancement at the back. \u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003cspan data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWith its unique acoustic configuration of seven drivers, Beosound Balance is made to deliver a strong bass performance and a broad sound image for truly room filling sound when you want it. The ability to provide beam forming technology also enables Beosound Balance to deliver sound directivity for focused listening from all positions – all in one package.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003c\/div\u003e\n\u003cdiv of Beosound Balance includes two 5.25'' bass drivers for powerful bass performance, two 2'' full range drivers, and one 3\/4 tweeter placed in the front for a clear, defined sound reproduction, and finally two 3'' full range drivers placed in the back that act as sound enhancers.\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-sln-id=\"undefined_description\"\u003e\u003cmeta charset=\"utf-8\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBeosound Balance is equipped with Active Room Compensation capabilities, which optimize your sound experience based on the positioning of the speaker in the room, in practice by actively adapting the speaker tuning to compensate for acoustic surroundings.\u003c\/span\u003e\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp ft²)\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eSpeaker Configuration: 2 x 5,25” woofer drivers, 2 x 3” fullrange drivers, 2 x 2” full range drivers, 1 x ¾” tweeter Amplifier, 2 x 200 watt class D for bass 2ohm, 2 x 100 watt class D for fullrange 4ohm, 2 x 100 watt class D for fullrange 4ohm, 1 x 50 watt class D for tweeters 6ohm\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp Set up the stereo pairing through the Google Home App.\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eAdvanced Sound Features: Active Room Compensation Beam, Width Control Beam, Direction Control (three sides), Thermal Protection Adaptive Bass Linearization\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eCustomizable Sound EQ: Presets available and fully customizable through Bang Olufsen App\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eMaterials: Oak Wood, Knitted Fabric, Aluminum Fabric Cable\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWeight: 7.2 kg; 10.4kg (with packaging)\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eDimensions: 20 W x 38 H x 20 D cm\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003ePower consumption: Typical 100 watts; Standby: 4,5 watt\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003ePower Supply: Fabric Power cable\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eBluetooth Version: 5.0\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eWi-Fi: Wi-fi\/WLAN 802.11 b\/g\/n\/ac (2.4 GHz 5 GHz), 2x2 MIMO\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eStreaming services: Chromecast built in, Apple AirPlay 2, Spotify Connect\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eInputs and outputs: 1 x Main Connection 1 x Line-in\/Optical combi-jack 2 x Ethernet 1 x USB-C\u003c\/p\u003e\n\u003cp data-mce-fragment=\"1\"\u003eVoice Assistant Integration: Beosound Balance can be controlled through the Google Voice Assistant.
